p: Over a 7-year period, a total of 11,398 patients were enrolled in the study and screened for RSV, PIV, HMPV, and 12 respiratory pathogens (Table 1). The median age of patients was 1.8 years (IQR, 0.8–3.8), and the sex ratio was 1.8:1. Of the 11,398 patients tested, 5606 (49.2%) had positive results for one or more of the pathogens of interest, and 17.9% (1001/5606) of positive patients were found to have coinfection with two or more pathogens. The median age of pathogen-positive patients was 1.5 years (IQR, 0.7–3.0), and positive patients had a higher sex ratio (1.9:1) than patients who tested negative for all pathogens (1.7:1) ( p = 0.002).
